info.title: JumpCloud APIs
info.description: V1 and V2 versions of JumpCloud's API.

post.summary: Run a Command assigned to a webhook

post.description: Return System Users in multi-record format allowing for the passing of the 'filter' parameter. The WILL NOT allow you to add a new system.

totalCount.description: The total number of systems users

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of records to return at once.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: The offset into the records to return.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description:
The comma separated fields used to sort the collection.
Default sort is ascending, prefix with `-` to sort descending.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description:
The comma separated fileds included in the returned records.
If omitted the default list of fields will be returned.

put.description: Update a system record by its id and return the modified system record in single record format.

delete.description: Delete a system record by its id. This command will cause the system to uninstall the JumpCloud agent from its self which can can take about a minute. If the system is not connected to JumpCloud the system record will simply be removed.

put.description: Update a system user record and return the modified record.

name.description: A unique name for the Tag.

systems.description: An array of system ids that are associated to the Tag.

systemusers.description: An array of system user ids that are associated to the Tag.

expirationTime.description: A date timestamp indicating when this Tag will expire itself. When a Tag expires it will revoke any system user to system associations.

get.description: Return a single command using the command ID.

put.description: Updates a command record from the command ID and returns the modified command record.

name.description: A unique name for the Tag.

systems.description: An array of system ids that are associated to the Tag.

systemusers.description: An array of system user ids that are associated to the Tag.

expirationTime.description: A date timestamp indicating when this Tag will expire itself. When a Tag expires it will revoke any system user to system associations.

put.summary: Update a systems or user's binding
put.description: Adds or removes a user binding for a system.

get.description: List system user bindings for a specific system in a system and user binding format.

totalCount.description: The total number of systems users.

put.description: Adds or removes a system binding for a user.

get.description: List system bindings for a specific system user in a system and user binding format.

trait:fields:fields.name: fields
trait:fields:fields.description:
The comma separated fileds included in the returned records.
If omitted the default list of fields will be returned.

trait:sort:sort.name: sort
trait:sort:sort.description:
The comma separated fields used to sort the collection.
Default sort is ascending, prefix with `-` to sort descending.

trait:limit:limit.name: limit
trait:limit:limit.description: The number of records to return at once.

trait:skip:skip.name: skip
trait:skip:skip.description: The offset into the records to return.

command.description: The command to execute on the server.

user.description: The ID of the JC managed user to run the command as.

systems.description: An array of system IDs to run the command on.

schedule.description: A crontab that consists of: [ (seconds) (minutes) (hours) (days of month) (months) (weekdays) ] or [ immediate ]. If you send this as an empty string, it will run immediately.

files.description: An array of file IDs to include with the command.

tags.description: An array of tag IDs to run the command on.

timeout.description: The time in seconds to allow the command to run for.

command.description: The command that was executed on the system.

system.description: The ID of the system on which the command was executed.

user.description: The user which ran the command.

files.description: An array of file IDs that were included with the command.

requestTime.description: The time that the command was sent.

responseTime.description: The time that the command was completed.

response.id.description: The ID of the parent command.

response.data.output.description: the stdout from the command that ran.
